RMP Executive Summary: 

This Executive Summary briefly reviews the major elements of the Risk Management Plan (RMP) for ZFS Riga, LLCs dry mill ethanol production facility located near Blissfield, Michigan. This summary is presented in response to the requirements of the United States Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) under Title 40 of the Code of Federal Regulations, Part 68 (40 CFR 68) and Section 112(r) of the Clean Air Act.
The ethanol facility is subject to the RMP rule due to the storage of natural gasoline (denaturant), a regulated flammable mixture, above the respective threshold quantity.

ZFS Riga, LLC is currently operating in a dormant mode with this RMP submittal intending to meet the regulatory requirements of the EPA Title 40 Part 68 due to the continuous onsite storage of natural gasoline.

1.	Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies
ZFS Riga, LLC is committed to protecting the environment and operating the facility in a manner that promotes the safety of employees and the public. Management has adopted and implemented policies that adhere to all applicable federal and state rules and regulations.
The design and construction of the facility has incorporated physical and operational safeguards to prevent accidental releases. Through the proper design, installation, operation and maintenance of the equipment, and the training of personnel, the site has minimized potential hazards to human health and the environment from fires, explosions, or any unplanned release of hazardous materials.

In the event of a release, the facilitys emergency response actions are described in its Emergency Response Plan (ERP). The ERP includes procedures to coordinate response actions with local emergency response personnel (i.e., law enforcement, fire, and rescue departments, emergency medical services, hospital and government personnel, etc.) as well as any potentially affected neighbors. In addition, the ERP is used to familiarize local emerge

ncy response personnel with the types of materials handled and the sites emergency response procedures.


2.	Facility Description and Regulated Substances Handled
ZFS Riga, LLC is a corn-based dry-mill ethanol fuel production facility producing approximately 60 million gallons per year of denatured ethanol when the plant is in an operating state.
Anhydrous ethanol is produced through the conversion of yellow dent corn to ethanol through a fermentation and continuous distillation process.

The regulated substance stored at the facility includes natural gasoline, which is used as a denaturant in the ethanol fuel product. The site has a maximum inventory of approximately 360,000 lbs of natural gasoline on site.


3.	Accidental Release Prevention Program and Chemical-Specific Prevention Steps
ZFS Riga, LLC has developed various written programs to address accidental release prevention measures required by the EPAs Risk Management Program, Prevention Program 3,  
and notification requirements of EPA's Emergency Response and Community Right-to-Know regulations. The facility complies with OSHAs 29 CFR 1910.119 Process Safety Management standards for the management of natural gasoline (denaturant).

An analytical review of the process is performed on a periodic basis utilizing an industry accepted HAZOP methodology. Recommendations resulting from the analysis are reviewed and modifications to the process or procedures are implemented if necessary.

Technical documents and information concerning the regulated process are maintained on file for technical reviews and regulatory compliance.

Employees working on or near the covered process are adequately trained in the hazards of the regulated chemical and the process operations. Written procedures have been developed to address the various modes of process operations and are reviewed on an annual basis for accuracy.

A formal maintenance program has been established for the regulated process which includes written procedures

, preventative maintenance, testing and inspections, and employee training. The maintenance program is intended to monitor the health and longevity of the equipment within the process and maintain the equipment to the highest degree possible.

The site has a documented system to review and approve potential modifications to the regulated process to ensure the modification has been adequately reviewed and is appropriate for the service conditions.

The site has an established Incident Investigation Program with procedures establishing the minimum requirements required in the event of a reportable release of the regulated chemical. In the event of a release, an investigation will be conducted to identify the contributing causes of the release and establish actions to be taken to prevent a similar occurrence in the future.

Audits are performed on a three-year basis to ensure compliance with the applicable provisions of the Risk Management Program.


4.	Accident History
ZFS Riga, LLC has not had a reportable incident involving the regulated chemical in the past five years.


5.	Emergency Response Program
The site Emergency Response Program is based on compliance with federal, state and local requirements.

The Plan addresses aspects of emergency response, including proper first-aid and medical treatment for exposures, evacuation plans and accounting for personnel after an evacuation, notification of local emergency response agencies and the public if a release occurs, and post- incident cleanup and decontamination requirements.
 
Employees and local authorities receive training in emergency response procedures as necessary to perform their specific emergency response duties.
The Plan is updated as necessary based on modifications made to facility processes, management practices, and/or procedures.


6.	Planned Changes to Improve Safety
ZFS Riga, LLC is continuously reviewing the site Process Safety and Emergency Response programs as knowledge is gained through periodic
audits, training, drills and industry experience.
